intro: Opopanax glaber, commonly known as the African bdellium, is a small, deciduous shrub native to the arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine and incense. Its leaves are small, leathery, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The bark and resin of Opopanax glaber contain various bioactive compounds, contributing to its medicinal value.
